intro: Pedicularis insubrica, commonly known as the Insubric Lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color, and its basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
